creator: rwvtveer@gmail.com
text:
Adding a user-defined variable to my test plan named 'test' with value 'http'
results in the following log message when a http request is passed through:

2005/07/12 11:33:29 ERROR - jmeter.gui.GuiPackage: Could not get GUI for 
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
org/apache/jmeter/protocol/${test}/sampler/HTTPSampler
	at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:141)
	at org.apache.jmeter.gui.GuiPackage.getGui(GuiPackage.java:172)
	at
org.apache.jmeter.gui.tree.JMeterTreeModel.addComponent(JMeterTreeModel.java:133)
	at
org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.proxy.ProxyControl.placeSampler(ProxyControl.java:606)
	at
org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.proxy.ProxyControl.deliverSampler(ProxyControl.java:274)
	at org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.proxy.Proxy.run(Proxy.java:138)

No http samples are recorded.

creator: jmeter@binarytwo.com
text:
This bug forces me to manually edit (find/replace) the HTTPSampler.protocol line
in my jmeter scripts with an xml editor.

Is there any chance of this making it into 2.1?

creator: sebb@apache.org
text: This is already in the 2.1 codebase though the coding is done slightly differently.
